'Gordon Matthew Thomas Sumner' (born 2 October 1951),
known by his stage name 'Sting', is an English musician, singer-songwriter, multi-
instrumentalist, activist, actor and philanthropist. He is best known as the
principal songwriter, lead singer and bassist for the rock band The Police
before launching a solo career.

Sting has varied his musical style, incorporating distinct elements of jazz,
reggae, classical, New Age, and worldbeat into his music. Stephen Thomas
Erlewine. [ Sting Biography]. Allmusic. Retrieved 7 November 2010 As a
solo musician and member of the Police, Sting has received 16 Grammy Awards
for his work, receiving his first Grammy for Best Rock Instrumental
Performance in 1981, three Brit Awards â winning Best British Male in
1994, a Golden Globe, an Emmy Award, and several Oscar nominations for Best
Original Song. He is a member of both the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and the
Songwriters Hall of Fame.
